articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Burkina Faso
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Burkina Faso
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Roch Marc Christian Kabore on his election as the president of Burkina Faso.
					 The message expressed belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger and wished the president success in his work for the stability and development of the country.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Gives Banquet for Weightlifters
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Gives Banquet for Weightlifters
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet Friday gave a banquet at Okryu Restaurant for the players who achieved excellent results in the 2015 World Weightlifting Championship.
					 Present there were Kim Su Gil, chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Choe Yong Nam, director of the General Bureau of Public Service who is chairman of the Weightlifting Association, officials concerned, players, coaches and their families. 
					
					 Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, in his speech congratulated Om Yun Chol, Kim Un Guk, Ri Song Gum and other weightlifters and coaches who demonstrated the dignity and spirit of the great Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea in the championship.
					
					 He called upon all the sportspersons to win more gold medals at international games.
					
					 Om Yun Chol in his reply speech pledged to glorify Juche Korea with gold medals by displaying the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu and the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu in training and games, true to the intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Forces' Fascist Suppression of People under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Forces' Fascist Suppression of People under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- People of all social standings in south Korea are now staging ever fiercer actions for justice, truth, democracy and the right to existence against the conservative ruling forces' moves for the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook and their unpopular rule.
					 Much upset by this, the conservative ruling quarters hurled tens of thousands of police into the operations for brutally cracking down on the participants in the actions and are kicking up a whirlwind of forcible seizure, search and arrest of leading members of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) which spearheaded the peaceful rally and dozens of organizations under it.
					
					 Puppet court authorities demanded prison terms for many guiltless personages and indicted them en masse on charges that they praised the north. The authorities are revealing their criminal attempt to let the puppet Intelligence Service put down the people's anti-"government" struggle by linking it with the DPRK.
					
					 A spokesman for the DPRK Measure Council for Human Rights in south Korea in a statement on Thursday said that what matters is that such fascist tyranny has assumed all the more indiscriminate nature since the south Korean chief executive ordered the repressive campaign, likening those who are opposed to the authorities' unpopular rule to terrorists of the "Islamic State" and threatening not to overlook them.
					
					 The repressive campaign in south Korea is an intolerable challenge to human rights and democracy as it is a fascist action to prolong the treacherous rule of the conservative ruling forces by mercilessly cracking down on the people opposed to sycophancy and treachery, the revival of "yusin" dictatorship and unpopular rule.
					
					 The fascist crackdown and hysteria have been revived in south Korea to ruthlessly violate the dignity and rights of the people, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 South Korea has now turned into the worst tundra of human rights and the land ill-famed for the worst human rights abuses in the world. This is an inevitable product of the conservative ruling forces' unpopular, undemocratic and unethical rule.
					
					 It is quite natural for the south Koreans to turn out in a mass struggle in protest against the present conservative forces who have driven their living into abject destitution, abusing their rights.
					
					 The south Korean conservative forces' tyranny against the people will spark off stronger resistance of the angry people and will never be able to evade bitter censure and denunciation by all the Koreans and the international community.

articles.title: Art Performance Showing Happy Life of Disabled Persons
articles.content:
Art Performance Showing Happy Life of Disabled Persons
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the Indoor Stadium of Kim Chaek University of Technology on Thursday to mark the International Day of Persons with Disabilities (December 3), at which the disabled gave an art performance featuring their proud looks.
					 Persons with disabilities are fully enjoying their rights under the Law on Protection of the Disabled in the DPRK.
					
					 Thanks to this law, children with disabilities are receiving education like the commons. The same is true of the case with children with severe disabilities.
					
					 The disabled can also get any jobs in accordance with their abilities.
					
					 The spirit of "One for all and all for one!" prevailing all over the country have turned the whole of society into one large, cheerful and harmonious family.
					
					 Among them are well-known instrumentalists, vocalists, artists and athletes.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause Supported by Cuban Figure
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause Supported by Cuban Figure
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Luis Enrique Gonzalez, president of Prensa Latina News Agency of Cuba, expressed his will to intensify media activities in support of the just cause of the Korean people when he met Pak Chang Yul, DPRK ambassador to Cuba, on Nov. 23.
					 Referring to the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation growing stronger recently, the president said: 
					
					 The DPRK re-clarified its fair and aboveboard stance to replace the Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) with a peace treaty at the 70th UN General Assembly.
					
					 It was prompted by the desire for defusing the danger of a war and ensuring lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 However, the U.S. keeps shunning this reasonable proposal.
					
					 This proves that the U.S. remains unchanged in its hostile policy towards the DPRK. 
					
					 The AA should be replaced with a peace treaty to put a definite end to the vicious cycle of confrontation and tension on the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. should prudently accept the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty.
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should make a bold decision on the issue of replacing the AA with a peace treaty.
					
					 If the peace treaty is concluded between the DPRK and the U.S., this will help settle other problems. 
					
					 The Cuban news agency will conduct active media activities in support of the just cause of the Korean people and the DPRK's stand.
					
					 It will as ever make efforts to develop the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation with the DPRK.

articles.title: New Posters Produced in Honor of WPK Congress
articles.content:
New Posters Produced in Honor of WPK Congress
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- New posters have been produced by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House, the Mansudae Art Studio, the Korean Central Fine Arts Studio and Pyongyang University of Fine Arts in honor of the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Poster captioned "Let's greet the 7th Congress of the WPK with high political enthusiasm and signal labor achievements!" calls upon all the party members and other working people to rise up in the struggle to make a proud present of labor achievement to the congress of the mother party.
					
					 Posters captioned "Let's adorn the 7th Congress of the WPK with great victory!" and "Let's adorn the 7th Congress of the WPK as a great festival of a victor!" depict the servicepersons and working people full of enthusiasm to proudly greet the congress with victory by dashing forward in the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu under the guidance of the great party.
					
					 A poster "Let's greet 7th Congress of the WPK with unprecedented labor successes!" depicts shining medal of hero, orders and other medals against the background of the party's flag. 
					
					 Poster captioned "Let us further display the might of single-minded unity!" reflects the servicepersons and people of the DPRK holding higher the flag of Juche-oriented party in a dynamic advance towards honorable month May against the background of picture depicting servicepersons and people single-mindedly united around the party and the leader.

articles.title: Exhibition and Presentation of Agricultural Science and Technology Successes Held
articles.content:
Exhibition and Presentation of Agricultural Science and Technology Successes Held 
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition and presentation of successes made in the agricultural science and technology this year took place here from Dec. 2 to 4.
					 They were divided into panels of agricultural crop seeds cultivation, crops cultivation, plant protection, soil fertilizers, vegetable, industrial crops, fruit culture, sericulture, veterinary and stock raising work.
					
					 On display there were more than 120 sci-tech achievements made by officials, teachers, researchers and technicians in the field of agriculture and co-op farms and more than 400 exhibits of at least 200 kinds including newly-bred high-yielding crops.
					
					 The participants swapped the achievements and experience gained in the work for breeding crops of new species and in the researches to put agriculture on a higher scientific and IT basis. 
					
					 The closing ceremony took place on Friday.

articles.title: Successes Made in Fishing
articles.content:
Successes Made in Fishing
Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Seasonal fishing is gaining momentum in the East Sea of Korea.
					Taking the lead in this campaign are Hongwon, Sinpho and Wonsan fishery stations occupying the main fishing grounds.
					
					They have introduced different methods of fishing while enhancing the role of shoal-finding ships.
					
					According to data available at the Ministry of Fisheries, the amount of catch reaches several hundreds tons on a daily average.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- An art troupe of Korean schoolchildren in Japan led by Sin Kil Ung, principal of Korean middle and high school in Tokyo, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Friday.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for End to History of Confrontation of Social Systems
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for End to History of Confrontation of Social Systems 
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- If the north and the south of Korea make efforts to mend their relations on the basis of tolerating the ideology and social system of other party, there will be no insurmountable hurdle, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is nonsensical to build confidence, while standing in confrontation.
					
					 Defusing the confrontation of social systems is prerequisite to improving the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 Pursuing the confrontation of social systems is a treacherous act of blocking the nation's reconciliation and unity and building a higher barrier of distrust between the north and the south. 
					
					 Two differing social systems have existed in the north and the south for the last several decades, but they provide no reason for pitting compatriots against each other. 
					
					 The north and the south agreed to achieve the reunification by federal formula through the adoption of the historic June 15 joint declaration and promised to solve the issue of the country's reunification independently by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations cannot be repaired by the unilateral efforts.
					
					 Whether the inter-Korean relations take the road of a fundamental improvement or not entirely depends on the attitude of the south Korean authorities.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not persist in their anachronistic row of confrontation of social systems but positively respond to the DPRK's efforts to pave the way for improving the inter-Korean relations by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Their Foul Acts Obstructive to Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Their Foul Acts Obstructive to Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- During the UN Climate Change Conference held in France recently the south Korean chief executive was busy calling on high-ranking politicians of different countries to solicit "international cooperation," crying out for "dialogue for denuclearization of the north" and their "positive role."
					 She in her "special address" at the UNESCO headquarters blustered that the "north's nuclear development and human rights issue are typical examples of the threat to the whole international community."
					
					 Minju Joson Friday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 What she uttered is no more than her last-ditch effort as she is taken aback by the daily increasing authority and might of the DPRK.
					
					 She is persistently hurting the dignity and social system in the north while shelving the human rights situation in south Korea in the mire of predicament.
					
					 This indicates that the south Korean conservative ruling forces remain unchanged in their confrontation racket but are set to further intensify it.
					
					 The DPRK values the improvement of the inter-Korean relations but will never pardon those who are keen to escalate confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north while hurting its dignity and social system.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are escalating the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north to achieve their ulterior aim while paying lip-service to "dialogue" and "peaceful reunification." This behavior will only touch off bitterer curses and condemnation by all Koreans and precipitate their self-destruction. 
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities would be well advised to stop their foul acts of hurting the fellow countrymen and doing harm to the process for improving the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: S. Korean Court Authorities Take Action against Progressive Public Figure
articles.content:
S. Korean Court Authorities Take Action against Progressive Public Figure
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Central District Court of south Korea on November 27 sentenced Hwang Son, representative of the Forum for the Study of Politics Desired, to 5 years in jail and to the same term of suspension of qualifications on charge of violation of the "Security Law".
					 The fascist court authorities took such action on the charge that she propagandized the social system of the north.
					
					 The ceaseless suppression of Hwang fully revealed the south Korean authorities' moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: KCTU Declares General Strike
articles.content:
KCTU Declares General Strike 
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a rally to declare an action for blocking the retrogressive revision of the labor law near the "National Assembly" on December 2, according to the south Korean paper Nodong and Segye. 
					 Speakers at the rally said that the ruling and opposition parties agreed to railroad the bill on labor despite of the workers' persistent demand for the right to existence, stabbing them in their backs. 
					
					 What remains to be done by the workers at present is to check the retrogressive revision of the labor law and bring down the present regime through the general strike, they declared. 
					
					 They stressed the need to judge the conservative "NA" through struggle only, calling for staging the second all-out people's action and general strike without fail to turn the area before the "NA" into the plaza for workers' action in December. 
					
					 A resolution was read out at the rally. 
					
					 At the end of the rally representatives of KCTU went to the "NA" to lodge protest with it, but gentries of the ruling party refused to meet them.

articles.title: Anti-"government" Actions Staged in Seoul
articles.content:
Anti-"government" Actions Staged in Seoul
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Minjok Ilbo on Dec. 2 said in an editorial Wednesday that members of the Korean Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy staged a demonstration toward the U.S. embassy in Seoul on December 1.
					 On the same day there took place a press conference denouncing the Intelligence Service (IS) for conducting the unwarranted search and launching a wholesale repressive campaign against the religious and labour circles, it noted, and continued:
					
					 All the participants in the actions strongly demanded the abolition of the "Security Law" and the dissolution of the IS, denouncing the present "government" for suppressing the pro-reunification movement organizations and patriotic people by invoking the fascist law.
					
					 The editorial said that the present "government" and the "Saenuri Party" are working hard to add the clause "dissolution of the organizations benefiting the enemy and anti-state organizations" by retrogressively revising the SL.
					
					 The present "government" also took a fascist action to disallow rallies to take place before the second all-out people's action and threatened to arrest the participants in rallies.
					
					 The present "government" and SL should vanish as early as possible so that independent reunification and democracy may come earlier.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A Bulgarian committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Sofia on Nov. 27.
					 Simeon Ignatov, president of the Central Council of the Bulgarian Anti-Fascist Union, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events such as a remembrance meeting, seminar, photo exhibition and film show on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Indonesia
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- An Indonesian committee for remembering H.E. Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 25.
					 Ristiyanto, chairman of the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events including a seminar and film show on the career and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il from Nov. 25 to Dec. 17.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Kuwait
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- A Kuwaiti committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Kuwait on Nov. 27.
					 Javid Ahmad, chairman of the Kuwait Asian Journalist Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to have the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il widely introduced by media and organize political and cultural events such as a remembrance meeting and film show between Nov. 27 and Dec. 17.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered Abroad
 Pyongyang, December 4 (KCNA) -- Various events took place in different countries on Nov. 24 and 26 to commemorate the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 They included a seminar on Marshal Kim Jong Un's work in Romania, round-table talks in Myanmar and a Korean film show in Nigeria.
					
					 Participants in the film show watched the Korean film "E-library of Kim Il Sung University".
					
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Socialist Party of Romania, explained the main contents of Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party".
					
					 The chairman said Kim Jong Un's work served as a valuable work comprehensively dealing with the ever-victorious history of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) which has developed under the guidance of the great leaders.
					
					 The chairman expressed conviction that the WPK headed by Kim Jong Un would grow stronger to be an invincible revolutionary party, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as its eternal general secretary. 
					
					 Tha Win, member of the Central Committee and secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, said Kim Jong Il worked heart and soul to develop the WPK into an invincible and steel-strong party, a motherly party deeply rooted among the popular masses and a general staff of the revolution leading the revolution and construction to victory.
					
					 Tha Win noted Kim Jong Il was not only a peerless patriot who ushered in the June 15 era of reunification but the world's political elder who made undying contributions to the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a nuevo presidente de Burkina Faso
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a nuevo presidente de Burkina Faso
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 3 un mensaje de felicitacion a Roch Marc Christian Kabore, electo presidente de Burkina Faso.
					  El remitente expresa su conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Burkina Faso, que tienen larga historia, se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas y le desea al destinatario exitos en su trabajo para la estabilidad y el desarrollo del pais.

articles.title: Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC ofrece banquete en honor de pesistas
articles.content:
Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC ofrece banquete en honor de pesistas
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 4 en el Restaurante Okryu un banquete en honor de los pesistas que obtuvieron buenos resultados en el Campeonato Mundial de Levantamiento de Pesas 2015.
					  En la ocasion participaron Kim Su Gil, secretario jefe del Comite del PTC en la ciudad de Pyongyang, Kim Yong Hun, ministro de Deportes, Choe Yong Nam, presidente de la Asociacion de Levantamiento de Pesas y director de la Direccion General de Servicios al Pueblo y otros funcionarios, jugadores, entrenadores y familiares.

articles.title: Represion contra pueblo surcoreano no podra evitar severa sentencia
articles.content:
Represion contra pueblo surcoreano no podra evitar severa sentencia 
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Se desarrolla mas violentamente en el suelo surcoreano la lucha de los habitantes de diferentes estratos contra las maquinaciones encaminadas a aplicar el "sistema de manual de historia redactado por el gobierno" y la politica antipopular de las fuerzas conservadoras en el poder y por la demanda de la justicia, la veracidad, la democracia y el derecho a vivir.
					Tan inquietada ante la realidad, la banda conservadora en el poder reprimio bestialmente a las masas participantes en la manifestacion movilizando a decenas de miles de policias y ejecuta la pesquisa forzosa a la Confederacion de Sindicatos Surcoreanos que dirigio ese mitin pacifico y decenas de unidades adscritas y arresta a sus miembros medulares.
					
					Y sentencia castigos a las personalidades inocentes imputandoles el inexistente "crimen" de haber encomiado a la RPDC. Ademas demuestra abiertamente su intento criminal de aprovechar el Servicio Nacional de Inteligencia para reprimir la lucha "antigubernamental" de los habitantes de diferentes clases vinculandola con la RPDC. 
					
					Adelanta asi el portavoz de la Sociedad de Medidas de DDHH en el Sur de Corea en su nota publicada el dia 3, y prosigue:
					
					Lo problematico es que tal locura fascista se torna mas indiscriminada y horrorosa despues de que la mandataria surcoreana insulto a los habitantes opuestos a su politica antipopular comparandolos con los terroristas del "Estado islamico" y dio la orden represiva parloteando que "nunca estaria con brazos cruzados ante el hecho".
					
					La represion violenta, que se comete en el suelo surcoreano, es un desafio intolerable a los derechos humanos y la democracia siendo la imprudencia fascista de aplastar despiadadamente a los habitantes en lucha contra la resucitacion de la dictadura de "renovacion" y la infame politica antipopular y mantener la gobernacion traidora de las fuerzas conservadoras en el poder.
					
					La represion y locura fascistas se resucitan hoy dia en el Sur de Corea y estas pisotean cruelmente la dignidad y los derechos de la poblacion.
					
					Debido a la gobernacion antipopular, antidemocratica y antietica de la banda conservadora en el poder, el territorio surcoreano se ha convertido en la peor tundra y zona de represion de DDHH en este mundo.
					
					Es muy natural que la poblacion surcoreana se movilice en la lucha masiva en protesta a las fuerzas conservadoras en el poder que violan los derechos humanos y llevan la vida del pueblo a la miseria.
					
					La violencia antipopular de los gobernantes conservadores surcoreanos causara la protesta mas grande y la lucha de las indignantes opiniones publicas y no podra evitar la condena y el repudio fuerte de los connacionales y la sociedad internacional.

articles.title: Creados afiches dedicados a septimo Congreso de Partido del Trabajo de Corea
articles.content:
Creados afiches dedicados a septimo Congreso de Partido del Trabajo de Corea 
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La Editora del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, la Casa de Creacion Mansudae, la Casa Central de Creacion de Bellas Artes y la Universidad de Bellas Artes de Pyongyang crearon los afiches dedicados al septimo Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea. 
					  El afiche "!Acogemos con el alto entusiasmo politico y los brillantes exitos laborales el VII Congreso del PTC!", exhorta a todos los militantes del Partido y trabajadores a levantarse en la campana para preparar el orgulloso regalo laboral al Congreso del Partido.
					
					  Los afiches "!Hagamos brillar con gran victoria el VII Congreso del PTC!", "!Hagamos valer el VII Congreso del PTC como gran festival de triunfadores!" y otros describen bien a los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea y los trabajadores de distintos estratos decididos a acoger dignamente el congreso del partido avanzando con el espiritu del viento cortante del Paektu bajo la direccion del gran Partido.
					
					  El afiche "!Manifestamos plenamente el poderio de la union monolitica!" refleja el aspecto del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea que unidos monoliticamente en torno al partido y el Lider avanzan con pasos firmes hacia mayo de la gloria tomando fuertemente en sus manos la bandera del Partido de Juche.

articles.title: Discapacitados coreanos gozan a sus anchas de vida dichosa
articles.content:
Discapacitados coreanos gozan a sus anchas de vida dichosa
Pyongyang, 4 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En el encuentro realizado en ocasion del Dia Mundial de Discapacitados 2015 (3 de diciembre), los discapacitados de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea mostraron su aspecto dichoso cantando y bailando a sus anchas, lo cual dejo una profunda impresion a los participantes.
					Gracias a la ley de proteccion de discapacitados de la RPDC, ellos gozan de una vida optimista con los derechos independientes y los intereses bien garantizados juridicamente.
					
					Bajo la gratitud del sistema de educacion socialista, los ninos discapacitados reciben la educacion preescolar y escolar al igual que los ninos normales. Se encuentran en el pais las escuelas especiales para los discapacitados.
					
					Por el sistema popular los discapacitados faltos de la capacidad laboral reciben con suficiencia las condiciones del trabajo y vida segun su esperanza y capacidad.
					
					Entre los discapacitados que se abniegan para la sociedad, el colectivo y el pais, se distinguen los maestros que dedican durante decenios toda su inteligencia y pasion para formar al musico nacional, los acordeonistas, los cantores, los pintores y deportistas talentosos.
